page.title: 14ECOLOGY OF COWFOLD.
page.content: {NATURAL HISTORY.} There are many wild flowers to be found in the Cowfold Area.In the hedgerows are dog roses,honeysuckle, may,brambles,sloes,bindweed and deadly nightshade.On the ground can be found scarlet pimpernel which is in fact orange,buttercups,daisies,clover, shepherd's purse,dandelions,poppies and cow parsley.In Spring bluebells and primroses are everywhere.The oak tree is the most common.Many kinds of animals can be seen.Rabbits are plentiful.There are many foxes and badgers,deer and adders can be found. Hedgehogs are numerous.There are many species of birds in the district like pigeons,rooks,owls,pheasants,jays, woodpeckers and the common garden birds.Insects found locally include the Cabbage White,Meadow Brown,Small Tortoiseshell and The Red Admiral.
